skill.name: pdf
skill.description: Comprehensive PDF manipulation toolkit for extracting text and tables, creating new PDFs, merging/splitting documents, and handling forms. When Claude needs to fill in a PDF form or programmatically process, generate, or analyze PDF documents at scale.
skill.summary: Process PDF documents with tools for extraction, creation, form filling, and conversion.
skill.author: Anthropic, PBC

security_audit.summary: Legitimate PDF processing skill. Uses standard Python libraries (pypdf, pdfplumber, reportlab) for document operations. No malicious code, no data exfiltration, no network calls, no persistence mechanisms.

content.value_statement: Working with PDFs can be time-consuming and error-prone. This skill provides automated tools for extracting text and tables, filling forms, merging documents, and creating new PDFs from scratch.
actual_capabilities: Extract text and tables from PDF documents
Fill PDF forms with data programmatically
Create new PDFs with custom content
Convert PDFs to images for analysis
limitations: Cannot decrypt password-protected PDFs without the password
Scanned PDFs require OCR for text extraction
Complex form layouts may require manual verification
Some PDF features may not be fully compatible across all viewers

use_cases.title: Automate form data entry
use_cases.description: Fill out PDF forms automatically with data from other sources.

use_cases.title: Extract table data from reports
use_cases.description: Pull structured table data from PDF reports into spreadsheets.

use_cases.title: Organize legal documents
use_cases.description: Merge and split legal documents efficiently.

prompt_templates.title: Basic text extraction
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract all text from this PDF document: [filename.pdf]

prompt_templates.title: Merge PDFs
prompt_templates.prompt: Merge these PDF files into one: [doc1.pdf], [doc2.pdf], [doc3.pdf]

prompt_templates.title: Fill form fields
prompt_templates.prompt: Fill out this PDF form with the following data: [provide field values]

prompt_templates.title: Create PDF report
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a PDF report with this content: [provide content]

best_practices: Verify output PDFs in a standard reader before distribution
Test form filling on copies before processing originals
Use high DPI when converting PDFs to images for better quality
anti_patterns: Do not assume all PDFs have extractable text
Do not skip validation when filling important forms
Do not process sensitive documents without backup copies

faq.question: Which Python libraries does this skill use?
faq.answer: pypdf for basic operations, pdfplumber for text and table extraction, reportlab for PDF creation, and pdf-lib for JavaScript environments.

faq.question: What file sizes are supported?
faq.answer: The skill handles PDFs of various sizes. Very large files may require more processing time and memory.

faq.question: Can I use this with other tools?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill integrates with command-line tools like qpdf and poppler-utils for advanced operations.

faq.question: Is my data secure?
faq.answer: All processing happens locally. No data is sent to external servers. PDFs are only accessed at specified file paths.

faq.question: Why is my extracted text incomplete?
faq.answer: Scanned PDFs need OCR. Some PDFs use encoding that requires special handling. Try the OCR workflow for scanned documents.

faq.question: How is this different from online PDF tools?
faq.answer: This skill processes files locally, works offline, and integrates directly into AI workflows without uploading documents.
